item.title: awslabs/aws-shell
item.description:
awslabs/aws-shell

aws-shell - An integrated shell for working with the AWS CLI.

item.title: Overcoming the business and technology barriers to DevOps adoption
item.description:
Overcoming the business and technology barriers to DevOps adoption

The topic of DevOps has dominated discussions at many of the major IT conferences this year, with suppliers and analysts lining up to warn enterprises about the business risks of failing to adopt a more agile approach to software development.

item.title: How to use customer feedback to drive your DevOps teams
item.description:
How to use customer feedback to drive your DevOps teams

DevOps and the cloud, the dominant topics in enterprise management discussions, are increasingly forcing R&D and operations leaders to rethink software delivery. Legacy methods just don't cut it anymore. They're too cumbersome, expensive, and disconnected from customers. So what do you do?

item.title: Love DevOps? Wait 'till you meet SRE
item.description:
Love DevOps? Wait 'till you meet SRE

You may have heard of a little company called Google. They invent cool stuff like driverless cars and elevators into outer space. Oh: and they develop massively successful applications like Gmail, Google Docs, and Google Maps. It's safe to say they know a thing or two about successful application development, right?

item.title: Newly minted DevOps consultancy roams world, looking for CIOs in pain
item.description:
Newly minted DevOps consultancy roams world, looking for CIOs in pain

London-based DevOps consultancy Contino has merged with a US-based counterpart with the combined entity getting a $30m cash boost from investment group Columbia Capital. The combined group will be making a play for the digital transformation business that has become an increasingly lucrative part of the Agile and DevOps game, and which they reckon will be hitting the flush financial services sector anytime now.

item.title: 9 hidden talents of devops ninjas
item.description:
9 hidden talents of devops ninjas

Devops is all about culture, with groups of teams working in concert toward a common goal. But as opposed to some workplace cultures, there are certain traits and talents all devops team members must have in common.

item.title: 5 cloud computing predictions for 2016
item.description:
5 cloud computing predictions for 2016

The salty tang in the air is the fragrance of a sea change in IT - a tidal shift that will change the role of IT and IT participants over the next five years.

item.title: 2016: The Tipping Point for DevOps
item.description:
2016: The Tipping Point for DevOps

While 2015 was certainly a big year for us as we joined the Red Hat family, in many ways we're still right at home with our roots deeply planted in the ways of open source.

item.title: Improving Build Time of Java Builds on OpenShift - OpenShift Blog
item.description:
Improving Build Time of Java Builds on OpenShift - OpenShift Blog

Since we released OpenShift 3 back in July 2015, one of the most common questions I get from developers is how to get better build time for Java based builds. In this post, I will guide you through the process of speeding up Java Maven based builds, and will explain other options that can be taken to the ones that I'll be showing.

item.title: Foundations of DevOps
item.description:
Foundations of DevOps

Debates about what DevOps is have been going on for several years. However, rather than being a static entity, with a single definition, DevOps may be closer to a practice, with some underlying principles that remain constant, and with forms and applications that vary according to the experiences of the practitioners.
